author: Staff Reporter
text:
A 40-year-old woman died and another was injured when a Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) cylinder exploded at a house in Arumbakkam on Sunday.

Arumbakkam police said the victim, Lakshmi, who is from Kallakurichi in Villupuram, was employed as a domestic help at the house where the incident occurred.

Lakshmi had entered the kitchen, turned on the cylinder and lit the stove when the cylinder exploded suddenly. The 40-year-old was engulfed in flames and by the time neighbours could reach out to help her, she was critically injured. She was rushed to the burns ward at Kilpauk Medical College Hospital, but she was pronounced dead on arrival by the doctors.

Shanti (55), another domestic help, who was present in the kitchen at the time of the incident, sustained 25 per cent burns and is receiving treatment at the hospital, the police said. The police are investigating the cause behind the explosion.
title: Cylinder blast in Arumbakkam kills domestic help
